profileText: A Representative from Virginia; born at ``Castle Hill,'' near Cobham, Albemarle County, Va., June 22, 1764; magistrate of Albemarle County; colonel of the Eighty-eighth Regiment, Virginia Militia; member of the State house of delegates 1788-1791 and 1797-1801; elected to the Third Congress (March 4, 1793-March 3, 1795); died at ``Castle Hill,'' near Cobham, Va., in March 1806; interment in the family cemetery at ``Castle Hill.''

researchRecord.name: In the William C. Rives Papers, ca. 1674-1939, approximately 50,400 items.
researchRecord.description: The papers include the papers of Francis Walker 1760-1795. These are microfilm copies of the originals at the University of Virginia.

researchRecord.name: In the Thomas Jefferson Papers, 1781, 1 item.
researchRecord.description: Commission to Francis Walker from May 26, 1781, appointing him ensign in the Virginia militia.

recordLocation.name: Albert and Shirley Small Special Collections Library

researchRecord.name: In the Thomas Jefferson Papers, 1790, 1 item.
researchRecord.description: A letter from Thomas Jefferson to Francis Walker written on November 3, 1790.
